Black daringly takes a third Pawn rather than play a move such as N-K2, for example, to block the diagonal and enable his King to reach safety.
I immediately form a battery on a second dangerous diagonal.
Presumably Black is trying to clear the decks for Q-side castling.
I immediately move another big gun into position. I cannot let Black have time to consolidate.
Black buys time by forcing...
...my Queen to recapture.
Intending to fianchetto.
I instantly launch my attack.
The Knight must be captured...
...but now there's no time to find shelter for the King.
Virtually forced.
If Black moves the King back, he enables a discovered check. But 17... QxB falls to 18 QxQ mate.
Staying alive...
Leaving only one move to prolong the agony.
He makes it.
Again forcing a lone reply.
Black cannot stop...
..the Rook from falling. He graciously resigns. I threaten 21 Q-N7 mate, and if 20... Q-N5 to stop it I play 21 Q-K8 mate.
